image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old man is due to face the Ballarat Magistrates' Court this afternoon, after he was charged with the murder of missing 51-year-old mother of three Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Ballarat man charged with murder of missing mum Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A family on a balcony

props.synopsis: Scientists say a failure by authorities to install extractor fans at Southern Cross Station has exposed people to avoidable health harms.

title.children: Living above Melbourne's Southern Cross Station, Catherine's family can smell the fumes

image.altText: A collage of images showing abusive teachers who worked in Victorian government schools

props.synopsis: The release of a 466-page report into historical sexual abuse at a Melbourne primary school will take weeks, perhaps months to fully digest. But for now, there is hope that it could kickstart a reckoning that may last for years, writes Russell Jackson.

title.children: A landmark school sex abuse inquiry has made horrific findings and the reckoning from it may last years

image.altText: A building site in the forest.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's outgoing president is leaving his utopian vision for a jungle capital to his successors to build. Will they pull the plug?

title.children: The $45 billion headache Indonesia has created deep in the jungles of Borneo

image.altText: A man with dark hair, wearing a suit, standing out the front of NT Parliament building with a stern expression

props.synopsis: NT Police Minister Brent Potter is under pressure over now-deleted Facebook posts he shared on his profile, which included homophobic and racial slurs and misogynistic language.

title.children: 'He was an idiot': NT chief minister backs police minister after racist Facebook posts

image.altText: A man folds his arms in front of factory boxes.

props.synopsis: Workers at an Albury-Wodonga air conditioning and heater factory are to be made redundant, with the company blaming Victoria's "reckless" transition away from gas.

title.children: 125 jobs to go as gas heater manufacturer blames rush to renewables for factory shutdown

image.altText: A woman with a large coat on looks on, away from the camera, as snow falls

props.synopsis: These wives and mothers of Russia's mobilised soldiers are risking the ire of Vladimir Putin and the Kremlin with their weekly protests, which come at an awkward time for the president.

title.children: Why wives and mothers could be a big problem for Vladimir Putin

image.altText: A jogger runs along the shore of Manly Beach after sunrise on the first day of Spring in Sydney, 2008

props.synopsis: As Victorians head into a hot and dry Labour Day long weekend, authorities are urging people to avoid travelling to state parks and forests if they don't need to, and advising festival-goers to prepare for temperatures of up to 40 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Victoria is facing a hot long weekend — here's what you need to know to stay safe

image.altText: Former Queensland state cricketer, Ian Harold King, 68.

props.synopsis: Justice Belinda Baker says Ian Harold King's "offending consisted of a grave breach of trust" at a time when he was working as a junior cricket coach in the ACT.

title.children: 'Master manipulator and predator': Paedophile cricket coach jailed for a further 23 years

image.altText: Spencer Leniu points to the sky during Sydney Rooster-Brisbane Broncos NRL match in Las Vegas.

props.synopsis: Sydney Roosters forward Spencer Leniu is facing a lengthy suspension following his admission he made a racist remark towards Brisbane Broncos five-eighth Ezra Mam during last Sunday's NRL match in Las Vegas.

title.children: Leniu apologises to Mam after admitting to racist slur

image.altText: A group of Australian athletes stand in Olympic uniforms with Sydney Harbour and the Harbour Bridge behind them.

props.synopsis: Indigenous artwork is taking pride of place on Australia's uniforms for the Olympic Games in Paris starting in late July.

title.children: Indigenous print with a nod to Japan. Australia unveils its Olympic uniforms

image.altText: The Tesla brand logo.

props.synopsis: Tesla quits the national car lobby, saying it has deceived customers over the government's proposed CO2 scheme for vehicles.

title.children: Tesla quits motoring lobby over claims group deceived customers on CO2 scheme

image.altText: Health care worker Desleigh Shields listens to a patient's heartbeat.

props.synopsis: The first drop of Closing the Gap target data for 2024 provides updates for eight of the 19 socio-economic targets, showing the agreement is not on track.

title.children: Latest Closing the Gap data shows only five out of 19 targets are 'on track'. Will the next generation get a fair go?

image.altText: A man from an Air Force search team in a headset looks out a plane window looking at the ocean.

props.synopsis: Searches costing $200 million were unable to locate flight MH370, but investigators are hopeful new technology and techniques will lead to the missing plane and solve the 10-year-old aviation mystery.

title.children: How do you search for a missing plane? Investigators hopeful new hunt will solve MH370 mystery

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Rust movie armourer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed.

props.synopsis: A New Mexico jury finds Rust armourer Hannah Gutierrez guilty of involuntary manslaughter, ending a trial over Hollywood's first on-set fatal shooting in nearly 30 years.

title.children: Jury finds armourer guilty of involuntary manslaughter in fatal shooting on set of Alec Baldwin movie Rust

image.altText: housing estate shot from a drone

props.synopsis: Lending for home loans has fallen. Meanwhile, the nation's would-be first Islamic bank fails to get a full licence. And ASX is up after wall Street optimism off the back of US Federal Reserve's chair reiterates that rates will come down this year. Read our live blog for more.

title.children: Home loan lending slumps, nation's first Islamic bank fails to get licence, ASX gains

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lobby group hits back at Tesla
ACCC says it watches the take-up of least-cost routing 'carefully'
Home loan lending slumps, first home buyers struggle

image.altText: A woman looks on with her hands behind her head.

props.synopsis: The manager of Sam Kerr's Women's Super League club says the Matildas star has its "full support", after she was charged with the racially aggravated harassment of a police officer in London.

title.children: Sam Kerr has English club's 'full support' as criminal charge looms over star

image.altText: Katy Gallagher at a budget press conference

props.synopsis: Parents accessing the government funded paid parental leave (PPL) scheme will soon be offered superannuation, but the change isn't set to come into place until the middle of next year.

title.children: Super to be added to paid parental leave from next year

image.altText: A gas facility in Pilliga forest.

props.synopsis: Gomeroi people who have successfully appealed against the Narrabri Gas Project say the ruling is groundbreaking and could set a precedent for other major fossil fuel projects.

title.children: Traditional owners celebrate Federal Court win in fight against $3.6 billion Santos gas development

image.altText: A headshot of Karen who wears a red blazer and stands with a serious expression in a living room infront of an arched window.

props.synopsis: The peak body for GPs says female doctors are earning less than their male colleagues because they're more likely to take on appointments for things like mental health and antenatal care, which attract lower bulk billing incentives.

title.children: Incentives to encourage bulk billing ignore the workload of female doctors, GP body says

image.altText: Joe Biden and Donald Trump do thumbs-up signals in two separate images.

props.synopsis: Nikki Haley's departure from the field confirms the US election will be between two old men who are broadly disliked. And Super Tuesday has highlighted challenges for both Donald Trump and Joe Biden, writes North America correspondent Carrington Clarke.

title.children: Super Tuesday's delivered an election contest America didn't want

image.altText: Black and white image of a woman wearing a dress in the foreground, old brick buildings and hand written papers in background.

props.synopsis: Until the late 1960s, abortion was illegal in Australia. With limited access to contraception, many women, like my great-grandmother, unlawfully attempted to terminate unwanted pregnancies.

title.children: My great-grandmother was just 36 when she died but before she did she had to hide the cause from police

image.altText: A woman in a blue police shirt stares ahead

props.synopsis: The shocking murder of Jesse Baird and Luke Davies should be a wake-up call to police forces across the country that for too long have been failing to take action against serving officers who commit domestic violence.

title.children: Will it take an alleged double homicide for police to take domestic violence by serving officers seriously?

image.altText: A flying fox with its wings outstretched, next to a tree branch filled with flying foxes

props.synopsis: WOMADelaide organisers say they have 'bat bins' on stand-by to remove bat carcasses from the festival ground, with forecasters predicting a heatwave for most parts of South Australia in the coming days.

title.children: Heatwave conditions forecast for long weekend in SA with 'bat bins' on stand-by at WOMADelaide

image.altText: Lucy Steed

props.synopsis: Recently released gender pay data will increasingly be used as governments and superannuation funds make decisions about where to invest and which suppliers they use. Firms with high pay gaps are on notice to improve or face tough questions.

title.children: Big gender pay gaps could start costing businesses money … a lot of money

image.altText: Close up of a crocodile's eye

props.synopsis: Wildlife experts explain possible reasons a 3-metre crocodile lurking in a popular creek didn't strike out at a family playing frighteningly close as a search discovers more crocs nearby.

title.children: A family came within metres of a crocodile in a swimming hole. So why didn't it attack?

image.altText: Dirt path cleared through section of National Park.

props.synopsis: A Townsville man has caused extensive damage to a national park after using a front loader to create a path to his property.

title.children: Man fined almost $145,000 for ploughing path through national park to access property

image.altText: Two ambulances with their lights on and emergency authorities. A helicopter is visible in the background.

props.synopsis: In a statement Australian Defence Force said first aid was rendered at the scene.

title.children: Soldier in hospital after parachuting incident during 'routine' training exercise

image.altText: Sally Dowling SC in a white blazer and blue top

props.synopsis: The director of public prosecutions, Sally Dowling SC, has ordered an audit of every sexual assault case committed for trial following criticism from some judges that merit-less cases were being pursued.

title.children: Every sexual assault case in NSW set for trial to be reviewed following judges' criticism

image.altText: Man with a cattle hat leans smiling against a rail

props.synopsis: Nobby the night watchman has been coming to the High Country cattle sales for 40 years, and keeping the cattle safe at night for 10. He says: "I'll be coming here till the day I die".

title.children: Behind the scenes at many cattle sales is the man who keeps the animals safe at night

image.altText: A very closeup photo of a woman's bright blue eye looking straight at the camera.

props.synopsis: The drug industry is pushing to bring psychedelic medicines to market after Australia became the first country to approve their use, as one company trials free MDMA-assisted therapy to first responders.

title.children: Free psychedelic therapy offered to first responders as biotech companies scramble to market

image.altText: Pope in a all white being wheeled by a man in a dark suit

props.synopsis: The pope has been suffering on and off this winter from a cold, bouts of bronchitis and the flu.

title.children: Pope Francis unable to get in Popemobile due to increasing illness

image.altText: Two cavoodles wearing a pilot and air hostess costume

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia has announced it plans to become the country's first airline to allow pets to ride onboard.

title.children: Virgin Australia set to allow pets to fly onboard

image.altText: A composite of two men and a harsh desert setting.

props.synopsis: Ray and James Dempsey were gold prospecting for almost a week in temperatures of more than 40 degrees before they were found dead in Western Australia's Murchison region, police say.

title.children: Gold prospectors urge better preparation after deaths of father and son in 'middle of the desert'

image.altText: A university graduate wearing a gown and cap is seen outside Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: Executive director of The Australia Institute, Richard Dennis, says the government collects more money from HECS than the PRRT. RMIT ABC Fact Check runs the numbers.

title.children: Does the government really collect more money from HECS than it does from the PRRT?
